net.hudup.core

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.Util

  • public final class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    This final class provides important static utility methods to create and initialize essential data structures used over Hudup framework such as Vector, List, Set, Map, and Queue. For example, if programmers want to create a List at anywhere in Hudup framework, they need to call the static method newList() instead of calling new ArrayList<T>(). The idea behind this class is that if programmers can used an improved data structure like ImprovedList over the framework, they just modifies the method newList() to return such ImprovedList. Moreover this class also provides advanced utility methods.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • isUsed

        public static boolean isUsed(double value)
        As a definition, a value is called used if it is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise it is called unused. This method checks whether or not the specified value is used.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether or not the specified value is used.
